content.webTitle: World Cup row forces draw delay

fields.headline: World Cup row forces draw delay
fields.bodyText: The draw for next year's World Cup, due to be held yesterday in Sydney, has been put back to next month when the International Rugby Board will debate Australia's decision to dump New Zealand as sub-hosts. An emergency meeting of Rugby World Cup Ltd will be held in Cardiff next week when the Australian Rugby Union will present its case for staging the 48-match tournament exclusively, but no final decision will be made until the council meeting in Dublin on April 12. The Australian union, backed by RWC, last week withdrew its invitation to the New Zealand RFU to stage 23 matches following the Kiwis' failure to agree to provide stadiums free of advertising and hospitality facilities because of existing contracts. The New Zealand union is trying to mobilise international board support as it seeks to be reinstated with backing from its own government. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
